mainBoard.name: Ancestral Recall
mainBoard.originalText: Draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.
mainBoard.text: Target player draws three cards.

foreignData.name: Todespresse
foreignData.text: Wähle einen Deiner Gegner. Hat dieser Gegner am Ende seiner Versorgungsphase mehr als vier Karten in der Hand, fügt die Todespresse ihm für jede über vier hinausgehende Karte 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Black Vise
mainBoard.originalText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during his or her upkeep, Black Vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as it enters and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in their hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

mainBoard.text:
As this artifact enters, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, this artifact deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.

mainBoard.name: Brass Man
mainBoard.originalText: Brass Man does not untap as normal; you must pay {1} during your untap phase to untap it.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

mainBoard.text:
This creature doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap this creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.
mainBoard.name: Candelabra of Tawnos
mainBoard.originalText: {X} Untap X separate lands.

rulings.text: Can be used on an untapped land.
This is not mana ability. It is a normal ability and it will resolve along with other spells and abilities on the stack. The lands untap during resolution.
You may untap your opponent's lands if desired.

mainBoard.text: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.

mainBoard.name: Clockwork Avian
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Put four +1/+0 counters on Avian. After Avian attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter.
During his or her upkeep, controller may buy back lost counters for {1} per counter; this taps Avian.

rulings.text: Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.
Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
This creature enters with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if this creature attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on this creature. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on this creature to be greater than four. Activate only during your upkeep.

foreignData.name: Kontrollzauber
foreignData.text: Übernimm die Herrschaft über die verzauberte Kreatur.

mainBoard.name: Control Magic
mainBoard.originalText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target creature is already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

foreignData.name: Gegenzauber
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen gerade gespielten Zauberspruch.

mainBoard.name: Counterspell
mainBoard.originalText: Counters target spell as it is being cast.
mainBoard.text: Counter target spell.

foreignData.name: Entzauberung
foreignData.text: Zerstöre eine Verzauberung oder ein Artefakt.

mainBoard.name: Disenchant
mainBoard.originalText: Target enchantment or artifact is destroyed.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.
mainBoard.name: Divine Transformation
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3.
mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

mainBoard.name: Eye for an Eye
mainBoard.originalText: Can be cast only when a creature or spell does damage to you. Eye for an Eye does an equal amount of damage to the controller of that creature or spell. If some spell or effect reduces the amount of damage you receive, it does not reduce the damage dealt by Eye for an Eye.

rulings.text: Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.
The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.

mainBoard.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

foreignData.name: Rückkopplung
foreignData.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers der verzauberten Verzauberung fügt ihm die Rückkopplung 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Feedback
mainBoard.originalText: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during its controller's upkeep.
mainBoard.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, this Aura deals 1 damage to that player.

mainBoard.flavorText: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.
mainBoard.name: Fire Elemental

foreignData.name: Feuerball
foreignData.text: Der Feuerball verursacht insgesamt X Schaden. Dieser wird gleichmäßig (abgerundet) über Zielkreaturen und/oder Spieler verteilt. Bezahle zusätzlich 1 für jedes Ziel mit Ausnahme des ersten.

mainBoard.name: Fireball
mainBoard.originalText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.

For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its mana value is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

mainBoard.name: Giant Tortoise
mainBoard.originalText: Giant Tortoise gains +0/+3 while untapped.
mainBoard.text: This creature gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

mainBoard.name: Island
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {U} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Island
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {U} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Island
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {U} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Land Tax
mainBoard.originalText: During your upkeep, if an opponent controls more land than you, you may search your library and remove up to three basic land cards and put them into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the “Snow-Covered” lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an “intervening ‘if' clause.” That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don't put any basic land cards into your hand.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

foreignData.name: Blitzschlag
foreignData.text: Der Blitz fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler 3 Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Lightning Bolt
mainBoard.originalText: Lightning Bolt does 3 damage to one target.
mainBoard.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

foreignData.name: Mahamoti-Dschinn
foreignData.text: Kann fliegen.

mainBoard.name: Mahamoti Djinn
mainBoard.originalText: Flying
mainBoard.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

foreignData.name: Mesa-Pegasus
foreignData.text: Kann fliegen, Bündnisfähigkeit

mainBoard.name: Mesa Pegasus
mainBoard.originalText: Flying, bands

rulings.text: A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it.

mainBoard.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

mainBoard.name: Mountain
mainBoard.originalText: Tap to add {R} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll
mainBoard.name: Pearled Unicorn

mainBoard.flavorText: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

Können fliegen.

Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

rulings.text: A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it.

mainBoard.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. foreignData.name: Kraftverlust
foreignData.text: Der Zielspruch wird neutralisiert, wenn dessen Urheber nicht sofort X ausgibt. Er muß alles verfügbare Mana aus seinem Manavorrat und seinen Ländern ausgeben, bis X bezahlt ist; wenn benötigt, kann er auch andere Manaquellen heranziehen.

mainBoard.name: Power Sink
mainBoard.originalText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana. Caster of target spell must draw and spend all available mana from lands and mana pool until X is spent; he or she may also spend mana from other sources if desired. If this is not enough mana, target spell will still be countered.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

mainBoard.flavorText: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

foreignData.name: Abtrünniger Zauberer
foreignData.text: {T}: Fügt einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Do 1 damage to any target.
mainBoard.text: {T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target.

foreignData.name: Umkehrschaden
foreignData.text: Aller Schaden, den Du bislang in diesem Zug von einer bestimmten Quelle erhalten hast, wird zu Deinem Lebenspunkten hinzuaddiert statt abgezogen. Wenn Du in diesem Zug noch weiteren Schaden aus dieser Quelle erhältst, wird dieser ganz normal behandelt.

mainBoard.name: Reverse Damage
mainBoard.originalText: All damage you have taken from any one source this turn is added to your life total instead of subtracted from it.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

mainBoard.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

mainBoard.flavorText: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

foreignData.name: Serra-Engel
foreignData.text:
Kann fliegen
Der Serra- Engel wird beim Angreifen nicht getappt.

mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Serra Angel to tap.
mainBoard.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

foreignData.name: Zauberspruchexplosion
foreignData.text: Der Zielzauber wird abgewehrt, wobei X für die Kosten des Zielzaubers steht.

mainBoard.name: Spell Blast
mainBoard.originalText: Target spell is countered; X is casting cost of target spell.

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don't affect a spell's mana value.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast's mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you'll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast's X and pay {9}{U}.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell with mana value X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

mainBoard.name: Spirit Link
mainBoard.originalText: For every point of damage target creature does, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the enchanted creature deals any damage, not only combat damage.

Unlike the lifelink ability, the ability of Spirit Link is a triggered ability that goes on the stack and may be responded to. Notably, if the enchanted creature deals damage at the same time you’re dealt enough damage to reduce your life total to 0 or less, you’ll lose the game before you can gain any life.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

foreignData.name: Wespennest
foreignData.text: 5, {T}: Bringe einen 1/1 Wespen-Spielstein ins Spiel. Behandle diesen Spielstein als eine 1/1 Artefaktkreatur mit Flugfähigkeit.

mainBoard.name: The Hive
mainBoard.originalText: {5}, ocT: Creates one Giant Wasp, a 1/1 flying creature. Represent Wasps with tokens, making sure to indicate when each Wasp is tapped. Wasps can't attack during the turn created. Treat Wasps like artifact creatures in every way, except that they are removed from the game entirely if they ever leave play. If the Hive is destroyed, the Wasps must still be killed individually.
mainBoard.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

mainBoard.name: Time Elemental
mainBoard.originalText:
{2}{U}{U}ocT: Return target permanent to owner's hand. Cannot target permanents with enchantment cards played on them.
If Time Elemental blocks or attacks it is destroyed and does 5 damage to controller.

rulings.text: You both sacrifice it and deal the 5 damage at end of combat.
A “permanent that isn’t enchanted” is a permanent with no Auras on it.
If Time Elemental attacks or blocks, but you no longer control it at end of combat, you can’t sacrifice it. However, it will still deal 5 damage to you.

mainBoard.text:
When this creature attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.name: Unstable Mutation
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3. Each round, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature during its controller's upkeep. These counters remain even if this enchantment is removed before the creature dies.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 is not permanent. It lasts until the end of the turn as do the abilities that are granted.

mainBoard.text: {0}: This creature gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

foreignData.text: {1}: Schützt Dich gegen allen Schaden aus einer roten Quelle. Wenn Dir eine Schadensquelle mehr als einmal in einem Zug Schaden zufügt, kannst Du jedes Mal 1 zahlen, um den Schaden zu vermeiden.

sideBoard.name: Circle of Protection: Red
sideBoard.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one red source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

sideBoard.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

rulings.text: Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

sideBoard.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

sideBoard.name: Magnetic Mountain
sideBoard.originalText: Blue creatures do not untap as normal. During their untap phases, players must spend {4} for each blue creature they wish to untap. This cost must be paid in addition to any other untap cost a given blue creature may already require.
sideBoard.text:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures they control and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

• Destroy target blue permanent.

foreignData.name: Wurzelkraft
foreignData.text: {1}: Jeder erfolgreich gesprochene grüne Zauberspruch gibt Dir 1 Lebenspunkt. Du kannst diese Eigenschaft sofort oder später während des Zuges anwenden, aber nur einmal pro grünem Zauberspruch.

sideBoard.name: Wooden Sphere
sideBoard.originalText: {1}: Any green spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a green spell is cast.
sideBoard.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
